# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line * " " * word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return lines
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there this is a really long sentence that I would like to wrap into shorter lines for better readability"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(join(wrapped_text, "\n"))
# Output should look something like:
# Hello there
# this is a really
# long sentence
# that I would like
# to wrap into shorter
# lines for better readability
